subject: SSL problem
msgSnippet: I m running java 1.3, so I know I need the SSL package, b/c it is not in incorporated in the Java bundle until ver. 1.4.  The specific error I m getting is
messageBody:
I'm running java 1.3, so I know I need the SSL package, b/c it is not in incorporated in the Java bundle until ver. 1.4. The specific error I'm getting is this:
[junit] java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.SocketException: SSL implementation not available [junit] at javax.net.ssl.DefaultSSLSocketFactory.createSocket(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.doConnect(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.NetworkClient.openServer(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpClient.l(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpClient.(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.a(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.a(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnection.connect(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnection.getOutputStream(DashoA6275) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.MessageBodyWebRequest.completeRequest(MessageBodyWebRequest.java:96) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebConversation.newResponse(WebConversation.java:65) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebClient.getResource(WebClient.java:157) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebClient.getResourceForWindow(WebClient.java:145) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebWindow.getResponse(WebWindow.java:109) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebWindow.sendRequest(WebWindow.java:99) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebRequestSource.submitRequest(WebRequestSource.java:204) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebForm.submit(WebForm.java:65) [junit] at com.meterware.httpunit.WebForm.submit(WebForm.java:54) [junit] at net.sourceforge.jwebunit.HttpUnitDialog.submit(Unknown Source) [junit] at net.sourceforge.jwebunit.WebTester.submit(Unknown Source) [junit] at net.sourceforge.jwebunit.WebTestCase.submit(Unknown Source) [junit] at EidTest.testAllCaps(EidTest.java:147)
I have the SSL jar I need in an included directory. If i take it out of there it throws a different error:
[junit] java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: https support requires the Java Secure Sockets Extension. See http://java.sun.com/products/jsse
So I know it's finding it, but why doesn't it work now?For reference, I'm trying to do some unit testing using JWebUnit on top of JUnit and automating it using ant.Thank you.
